Basic functions for stimulus attribute objects

Source: R/st_attrib_operators.R
st_attrib-operators.Rd

Basic functions for stimulus attribute objects

# S4 method for class 'st_attrib,numeric'
x[i, j, ..., drop = TRUE]

# S4 method for class 'st_attrib'
dim(x)

# S4 method for class 'st_attrib'
colnames(x)

# S4 method for class 'st_attrib'
rownames(x)

# S4 method for class 'st_attrib'
names(x)

# S4 method for class 'st_attrib'
as.data.frame(x, row.names = NULL, optional = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

x

a st_attrib object.

i, j

indices to use in subsetting.

...

not used, exists for compatibility.

drop

not used, exists for compatibility.

row.names

not used, exists for compatibility.

optional

not used, exists for compatibility.

Examples

x <- stimattrib_reading
x[1:10]
#>    STINDEX STID NITEM CONTENT
#> 1        1 S751     9       1
#> 2        2 S757     5       1
#> 3        3 S760    11       1
#> 4        4 S762    11       1
#> 5        5 S765    11       2
#> 6        6 S772    11       2
#> 7        7 S774    11       1
#> 8        8 S781     8       2
#> 9        9 S786    11       1
#> 10      10 S790     6       1
dim(x)
#> [1] 35  4
ncol(x)
#> [1] 4
nrow(x)
#> [1] 35
colnames(x)
#> NULL
rownames(x)
#> NULL
names(x)
#> [1] "STINDEX" "STID"    "NITEM"   "CONTENT"
as.data.frame(x)
#>    STINDEX STID NITEM CONTENT
#> 1        1 S751     9       1
#> 2        2 S757     5       1
#> 3        3 S760    11       1
#> 4        4 S762    11       1
#> 5        5 S765    11       2
#> 6        6 S772    11       2
#> 7        7 S774    11       1
#> 8        8 S781     8       2
#> 9        9 S786    11       1
#> 10      10 S790     6       1
#> 11      11 S806     8       1
#> 12      12 S809    10       2
#> 13      13 S812    11       1
#> 14      14 S813    11       2
#> 15      15 S815     9       1
#> 16      16 S820     7       2
#> 17      17 S824     8       2
#> 18      18 S833     6       1
#> 19      19 S836     6       1
#> 20      20 S852     6       1
#> 21      21 S866     9       1
#> 22      22 S867     8       1
#> 23      23 S887    11       1
#> 24      24 S899     7       2
#> 25      25 S904     5       1
#> 26      26 S913     8       1
#> 27      27 S915     7       2
#> 28      28 S918     9       1
#> 29      29 S922    11       1
#> 30      30 S924    11       1
#> 31      31 S926    12       2
#> 32      32 S927     7       2
#> 33      33 S934     7       2
#> 34      34 S936     9       2
#> 35      35 S944     6       2
